page.title: 02OTTRY'S LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: Ottery became the headquarters of the King's troops. They withdrew when the Parliamentary army advanced. Thomas {Fairfax}Commander_in_chief stayed at{Chanters House}and his troops were quartered in the Church. In 1688 {William Prince of Orange}dined at Ottery when he was on his way to London to take the crown from James II. In 1772, Samuel Taylor Coleridge the poet was born in Ottery.His father was vicar of Ottery and master of Kings School. Samuel Taylor Coleridge had a fight with his brother Frank and ran away down by the river and slept there. In 1866 Ottery suffered a serious fire 111 houses were destroyed and 500 people became homeless.
